title: thunderbird folder properties/compact won't launch
content:
Hi !

I'm running Thunderbird 129 (beta) on Win10. Long time user & fan of TB...

Currently, right-clicking on Properties or Compact for any folder won't launch/start anything in my TB. Any clue ? Many thanks !

Bit of context: . I'm running numerous accounts and folders; . here, I wanted to compact some folders to bring some hygiene to my mail boxes; . I've been running huge Inboxes (10ks of emails, Inbox file of several GBs... I know, this is BAD ! sorry...) . some of my folders are starting to show corruption symptoms (dates 1970, rubbish text in preview, nstmp folders...) . my TB is parametered to compact when 200MB are saved (though I doubt it actually does) . I used to have msgs requiring me to compact folders, but don't seem to have them any more (maybe the system got tired with my ignoring it ;)

I have read different threads about Compacting (Complications, workaround, Compacting folders...) and folders, but didn't found any solution/workaround. note: I haven't seen any post reporting this specific issue (right-click menu opens, but functionnalities there -such as Properties or Compact- seem inactive or somehow dis-activated).

I tried disactivating any download, and moved huge nstmp files out of the TB folders (trying to make them somewhat lighter).

Many thanks for your help !
creator: utestit

title: Transferring emails to a new computer
content:
I wish to transfer my Thunderbird accounts (i.e. I have two different email addresses in one Thunderbird installation) from my 'old' PC to my 'new' laptop.

Historically I have backed up my emails by copying the Thunderbird folder from <user>/AppData/Roaming/Thunderbird and pasting it to my backup disk. This has worked well for more than 6 years. In that time, I've had to recover a couple of times by simply re-installing Thunderbird, establishing it with my main email account (ian_and_maureen@yahoo.co.uk), then replacing the newly established .../Roaming/Thunderbird folder with the archived one, thus recovering all my subfolder data in the Inbox of ian_and_maureen... plus a second email address.

I've tried to do this with the laptop, but I don't fully recover the historical data, all I get is the current Inboxes for the two accounts with no historical data. Can you advise me what I'm doing wrong? If this is the wrong way, what is the correct way? It seems essentially the same action as is described by the guide found at Moving Thunderbird Data to a New Computer | Thunderbird Help (mozilla.org)

My PC is running Windows 10 Version 22H2 (OS Build 19045.4717) with Thunderbird Version 115.13.0 (32-bit). The Laptop is Windows 11 Version 23H2 (OS Build 22631.3958 with Thunderbird Version 115.13.0 (64-bit)

title: avviso da microsoft
content:
Ho ricevuto il seguente messaggio da Microsoft. Potrò ancora usare Thunderbird per leggere la mia posta di Outlook?

'"Il 16 settembre 2024, le app che usano tecnologie di accesso meno sicure non saranno più in grado di accedere alla tua posta elettronica.

La sicurezza delle tue informazioni è una priorità assoluta per Microsoft. Per proteggere il tuo account, Microsoft non supporta più l'utilizzo di app di posta e calendario di terze parti che ti chiedono di accedere solo con il nome utente e la password del tuo account Microsoft. Per una maggiore sicurezza, dovrai usare un'app di posta o calendario che supporta i metodi di autenticazione moderna di Microsoft. In caso contrario, le tue app di posta elettronica di terze parti non saranno più in grado di accedere al tuo indirizzo e-mail di Outlook.com, Hotmail o Live.com il 16 settembre 2024.

Cosa devi fare?

Se ricevi questo messaggio di posta elettronica, significa che stai usando un'app di posta o calendario che utilizza un metodo di autenticazione meno sicuro per connettersi al tuo account di posta elettronica di Outlook.com. Dovrai aggiornare l'app di posta e calendario di terze parti a una versione che supporta i metodi di autenticazione moderna.

Microsoft fornisce versioni gratuite di Outlook per PC e dispositivi Mac, iOS e Android che puoi scaricare e connettere facilmente al tuo account di posta elettronica. Usando una versione aggiornata di un'applicazione di Outlook potrai connetterti nel modo più sicuro.

Come puoi configurare Gmail, Apple Mail o un'altra applicazione di posta elettronica di terze parti?

Per varie applicazioni non Microsoft ci saranno procedure specifiche per connettersi all'account di posta elettronica di Outlook.com con metodi di autenticazione moderna. Consulta il nostro articolo della guida: Metodi di autenticazione moderna ora necessari per continuare a sincronizzare la posta di Outlook nelle app di posta elettronica non Microsoft. Puoi anche contattare i creator di tali applicazioni per farti dare tutte le istruzioni necessarie. In molti casi, basterà rimuovere e aggiungere di nuovo il tuo account con l'ultima versione di tale applicazione per configurare l'utilizzo dei metodi di autenticazione moderna.
creator: daniele.divenosa

title: Cannot attach large file after upgraded to 115
content:
Since we upgraded to 115, most of our PC cannot forward email larger than 5MB to team members. One or two PC can sometimes send without problem but not always.

We can press "forward" and the compose new email window comes up as it has always been. But when we press "send", it will stall for a while then responded "Cannot send email". Press "OK" and sometimes it will then respond "Creating email" or something like that. The sequence could be reversed (create first then cannot send). Cannot even save as Draft into the Draft folder on our own manged MDaemon mail server on our local LAN.

Thinking it is all due to the forwarded email being too big, tried many many times over weeks checking MD setting, LAN and individual local PC setting but still cannot resolve.

Today I tried something completely different. Instead of "forwarding one large email", I tried to attach large attachments like .jpg etc and found that it is the "attachment process" that is causing the problem. If I attach a larger file, say 10MB, it is problem. If I attach several small files, it sometimes go through even the total file size exceed 10MB. The I tried attaching just a few attachments, save to draft folder, close the compose window, re-select the draft email and then add more file. Repeating this several times I managed to be able to save to draft folder on the server and then send out an email of 49.9MB. I keep on playing with it for hours but I could repeat and can only managed to do something like 10MB/11MB.

This is still much better than trying to "forward an email" (as attachment or in-line) which we can only do up to about 5MB max.

Please help to resole this problem.
creator: arthur.wong
